title: American_Top_40_1974_May_25th
description:
"Record stores sell em', radio stations play em', Billboard ranks em', and AT40 counts em' down."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

THIS BROADCAST ENDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE LAST SONG.

In this broadcast:

As of this countdown, five Beatles covers made the charts that were never released by the Fab Four. This chart makes it six with the highest debuting record of the week..

Due to the popularity of the television show, "Happy Days," Rock Around The Clock, by Bill Haley & The Comets reappears on the chart after 19 years.

One singer in the countdown has had more than 80 chart records, and has never hit number one.

There is a song in the countdown that created maybe the wildest chart coincidence in the rock era. Since 1955, only two songs ever made number one twice (each by different artists), AND both of those songs were written by the same song-writing team!

There is a hit in the countdown written by the man who also wrote one of the first million sellers of the 21st century, without ever selling a single record.

39: Rock Around The Clock - Bill Haley & The Comets
